title: Smart Data Models - LoadGenericNonLinear
description: Adapted from CIM data models. These load models (known also as generic non-linear dynamic (GNLD) load models) can be used in mid-term and long-term voltage stability simulations (i.e., to study voltage collapse), as they can replace a more detailed representation of aggregate load, including induction motors, thermostatically controlled and static loads.

type.description: Property. NGSI type. It has to be LoadGenericNonLinear

bs.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Steady state voltage index for reactive power (BS). Default: 0.0

bt.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Transient voltage index for reactive power (BT). Default: 0.0

genericNonLinearLoadModelType.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Type of generic non-linear load model. Default: None

ls.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Steady state voltage index for active power (LS). Default: 0.0

lt.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Transient voltage index for active power (LT). Default: 0.0

pt.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Dynamic portion of active load (P). Default: 0.0

qt.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Dynamic portion of reactive load (Q). Default: 0.0

tp.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Time constant of lag function of active power (T). Default: 0

tq.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Time constant of lag function of reactive power (T). Default: 0
